subject: Ethics
title: AI Winter to AI Spring
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on AI Winter to AI Spring.

hook.text: In 1970, AI researchers promised machines would think like humans within a decade. Funding poured in.

buildup.text: The promises collapsed. Machines couldn't understand language or see images. Funders pulled out.

discovery.text: Two 'AI winters' froze progressâ€”first in the 1970s, then the late 1980s. Hype outran reality both times.

twist.text: Deep learning changed everything after 2012. Suddenly AI could see, speak, and write. Spring arrived.

climax.text: But the ethical questions frozen during winter thawed tooâ€”bias, jobs, privacyâ€”all at once, all urgent.

punchline.text: The tech caught up. The ethics never left the winter.

quiz.question: What caused AI winters?
options: AI hype exceeded actual capabilities, causing funding to collapse
Scientists lost interest in artificial intelligence
